Function ifx::tlx493d::initCommunication(TLx493D_t *, SPIClass&, bool, uint32_t, uint8_t, uint8_t)¶

  • Defined in File SPIUsingSPIClass.cpp

Function Documentation¶

bool ifx::tlx493d::initCommunication(TLx493D_t *sensor, SPIClass &spi, bool executeInit = false, uint32_t clockFreq = 200000, uint8_t bitOrder = MSBFIRST, uint8_t dataMode = SPI_MODE2)¶

The function initCommunication is used to initialize the communication interface of the sensor. In this case the SPI interface. The communication interfaces is determined automatically depending on the chosen sensor.

Parameters

  • sensor – [inout] A pointer to a TLx493D_t struct, which represents the TLx493D sensor.

  • spi – [inout] A pointer the used SPIClass instance.

  • executeInit – [in] Boolean flag which determines whether the initialization is executed or not. The default value is false.

  • clockFreq – [in] Desired clock frequency of the SPI-bus. The default value is 200000.

  • bitOrder – [inout] Determines the desired bit order of the communication. MSB or LSB first. Default value is MSBFIRST.

  • dataMode – [inout] Determines the desired data mode for the SPI communication. The default values is SPI_MODE2.

Return values

  • 0 – Error.

  • 1 – Success.

Returns

A boolean value which indicates if the initialization was successful or not.
